title: HMRC sacks eight staff members over inappropriate behaviour
text:
HM Revenue & Customs has disciplined almost 100 members of staff for inappropriate use of computer systems, email and social media over the last two years.

In 2017-18, the tax authority was forced to sack eight employees for abusing computer systems, a freedom of information request has revealed. In many cases those reprimanded were repeat offenders.

The number of employees formally rebuked over their behaviour is significantly higher than at the Metropolitan and British Transport Police forces, where just 18 and 11 members of staff were handed formal disciplinaries respectively over the same time period, separate figures showed.

It comes as the tax police has more power than ever before...
